page.title: 15L'TON HARBOUR LONG AGO
page.content: Littlehampton Harbour was a major shipbuilding port in the 19th century specialising in the building of wooden ships. The ships built in the harbour in the 19th century were the Ketch,Brig and Barque-the largest being the Barque and the smallest the Ketch. The river in the harbour was called the Arundel River which cut through the Chalk Downs and flowed towards Horsham. The River Arun is constantly silted up with sand and mud flowing down the river,so every so often it is dredged to clear it. Famous names associated with Littlehampton Harbour were Corney & Carver,Thomas Isemonger and Stephen Olliver.With the help of these people the harbour flourished.
